qas.question: Cork is home to which internationally famous brewery?
What is the Ferro Factory known for producing?

answers.text: 45% of the world's Tic Tac sweets

qas.question: Which car company closed the doors on it's Cork operations in 1984?
What online retail giant has operations at the Cork Airport Business Park?
Why was it natural to have Ford Motor Company based in Cork?

answers.text: Henry Ford's grandfather was from West Cork

qas.question: What brewery took over Heineken in 2008?
Where are most of the world's Tic Tacs made?
What car manufacturer came to Cork in 1984?
What did Beamish and Crawford brewery take over in 1984?
How many people in the city drink Heineken?
In what year did Ford open its first factory in Beamish?
What famous company owner's grandfather was from Beamish?
Where has the Heineken Brewery set up its main location?

context: The city is also home to the <a0_0>Heineken<a0_0/> Brewery that brews Murphy's Irish Stout and the nearby <b5_0>Beamish and Crawford brewery<b5_0/> (taken over by <b9_0>Heineken<b9_0/> in <b11_0>2008<b11_0/>) which have been in the city for generations. <a1_0><b10_0>45%<b10_0/> of the world's Tic Tac sweets<a1_0/> are manufactured at the city's <b6_0>Ferrero factory.<b6_0/> For many years, Cork was the home to <a2_0><b7_0>Ford Motor Company<b7_0/><a2_0/>, which manufactured cars in the docklands area before the plant was closed in 1984. <a4_0><b8_0><b12_0>Henry Ford<b8_0/>'s<b12_0/> grandfather was from West Cork<a4_0/>, which was one of the main reasons for opening up the manufacturing facility in Cork. But technology has replaced the old manufacturing businesses of the 1970s and 1980s, with people now working in the many I.T. centres of the city – such as <a3_0>Amazon.com<a3_0/>, the online retailer, which has set up in <b13_0>Cork Airport Business Park<b13_0/>.
